sections.markdown:
# DQL Uses Cases & Best Practices
Este Notebook proporciona documentaci贸n y casos de uso con DQL.

**Preguntas o feedback?**: [angelica.barranco@dynatrace.com](mailto:angelica.barranco@dynatrace.com?subject=Feedback%20on%20Grail)

Para obtener m谩s informaci贸n sobre Dynatrace Query Language (DQL), vaya aqu铆:
* [(Doc) Dynatrace Query Language (DQL)](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dql-dynatrace-query-language-hub)
* [(Doc) DQL commands](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dql-commands-overview)
* [(Video) A Practical Guide to DQL](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F2VbVqNlswk)
* [(APP) Learn DQL](https://wkf10640.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/apps/dynatrace.learndql/)

## Como inicio una query?

Una query puede iniciar con uno de estos **4** comandos:
* `data` : Genera datos de muestra durante el tiempo de ejecuci贸n de la consulta.
* `describe`: Describe el esquema de datos para un objeto de datos determinado.
* `fetch`: Carga datos del recurso especificado.
* `timeseries`: Combina cargar, filtrar y agregar datos de m茅tricas en una salida de time series.

# [`data`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#data)
> Genera datos de muestra durante el tiempo de ejecuci贸n de la consulta.

Lista de tipos de datos ingestados en Dynatrace (spans, RUM, bizevents, sythectic). 
* Si esta disponible en Grail `storage.grail = true`.
* Si esta disponible en almacenamiento cl谩sico `storage.classic = true`.

input.value:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true)

grail.canonicalQuery: data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = TRUE), record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = TRUE, storage.classic = TRUE), record(data = "spans", storage.grail = TRUE), record(data = "RUM", storage.grail = TRUE), record(data = "bizevents", storage.grail = TRUE, storage.classic = TRUE), record(data = "sythectic", storage.grail = TRUE)
grail.query:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true),
     record(data = "spans", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "RUM", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "bizevents", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true),
     record(data = "sythectic", storage.grail = true)

input.value:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true),
     record(data = "spans", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "RUM", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "bizevents", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true),
     record(data = "sythectic", storage.grail = true)

sections.markdown:
# [`describe`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#describe)
> Describe el esquema de datos para un objeto de datos determinado.

Cuantas propiedades/fields conocidos tienen los `host` en este ambiente? Y listar por orden alfabetico.

*Hints:*
* Usar [Ordering commands](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/ordering-commands)

input.value:
describe dt.entity.host
| sort field asc

sections.markdown:
# [`fetch`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#fetch)
> Carga datos del recurso especificado.

Listar los host. Mostar solo `nombre`, `ip` y `tags`.

*Hints:*
* Usar el resultado de la query anterior.
* Usar [`Selection and modification commands`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/selection-and-modification-commands)

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch dt.entity.host
| fieldsAdd ipAddress, tags
| fieldsRemove id
| fieldsRename nombre = entity.name, ip = ipAddress
grail.query:
fetch dt.entity.host
| fieldsAdd ipAddress, tags
| fieldsRemove id
| fieldsRename nombre=entity.name, ip=ipAddress

input.value:
fetch dt.entity.host
| fieldsAdd ipAddress, tags
| fieldsRemove id
| fieldsRename nombre=entity.name, ip=ipAddress

sections.markdown:
# [`timeseries`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#fetch)
> Cargar, filtrar y agregar datos de m茅tricas en una salida de time series.

Tiempo del tiempo de respuesta promedio (ms) del servicio con mayor cantidad de peticiones de las 煤ltimas 24h.

*Hints:*
* Usar [Array functions](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/array-functions)

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.service}, {`tiempo de respuesta` = avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones = sum(dt.service.request.count)}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| limit 1
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)
grail.query:
timeseries {`tiempo de respuesta`=avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones=sum(dt.service.request.count )}, by:{dt.entity.service}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| limit 1
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)

metrics.description: Response time of a service measured in microseconds on the server side (server side measurements do not include e.g. proxy and networking times). Response time is the time until a response is sent to a calling application, process or other service. It does not include further asynchronous processing. To learn how Dynatrace calculates service timings, see [Service analysis timings](https://dt-url.net/service-timings).
Number of requests received by a given service. To learn how Dynatrace detects and analyzes services, see [Services](https://dt-url.net/am-services).

input.value:
timeseries {`tiempo de respuesta`=avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones=sum(dt.service.request.count )}, by:{dt.entity.service}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| limit 1
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)

sections.markdown:
Agregar a la query anterior el uso promedio de cpu `dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_usage` del container de todos los servicios que corran en k8s.

*Hints:*
* Usar [Correlation and join commands](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/correlation-and-join-commands)

records.dt.entity.service.name: [eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of server.js (frontend) my-otel-demo-frontend-*
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of server.js (frontend) my-otel-demo-frontend-*
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of kafka.Kafka my-otel-demo-kafka-*
[eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of oteldemo.AdService my-otel-demo-adservice-*
[eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of kafka.Kafka my-otel-demo-kafka-*
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of oteldemo.AdService my-otel-demo-adservice-*
[eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of frauddetectionservice-*-all.jar my-otel-demo-frauddetectionservice-*
[eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of index.js (paymentservice) my-otel-demo-paymentservice-*
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of index.js (paymentservice) my-otel-demo-paymentservice-*
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of frauddetectionservice-*-all.jar my-otel-demo-frauddetectionservice-*
[eks][easytrade] Requests executed in background threads of SpringBoot com.dynatrace.easytrade.engine.EngineApplication easytrade production
[eks][easytrade] Requests executed in background threads of SpringBoot com.dynatrace.easytrade.creditcardorderservice.Application easytrade production
[eks][obslab-release-validation] Requests executed in background threads of kafka.docker.KafkaDockerWrapper my-otel-demo-kafka-*
[eks][obslab-log-problem-detection] Requests executed in background threads of kafka.docker.KafkaDockerWrapper my-otel-demo-kafka-*

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.service}, {`tiempo de respuesta` = avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones = sum(dt.service.request.count)}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)
| fieldsAdd belongs_to = entityAttr(dt.entity.service, "belongs_to")
| fieldsFlatten belongs_to
| fieldsAdd dt.entity.cloud_application = arrayFirst(belongs_to.dt.entity.cloud_application)
| filter isNotNull(dt.entity.cloud_application)
| join 
	[
		timeseries by:{dt.entity.cloud_application}, `cpu_usage container` = avg(dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_usage)
		| fieldsAdd `cpu_usage container (avg)` = arrayAvg(`cpu_usage container`)
	], on:{dt.entity.cloud_application}, fields:{`cpu_usage container`, `cpu_usage container (avg)`}
| fields dt.entity.service, dt.entity.service.name, `peticiones (total)`, `tiempo de respuesta (avg)`, `cpu_usage container (avg)`
grail.query:
timeseries {`tiempo de respuesta`=avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones=sum(dt.service.request.count )}, by:{dt.entity.service}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)
| fieldsAdd belongs_to = entityAttr(dt.entity.service, "belongs_to")
| fieldsFlatten belongs_to
| fieldsAdd dt.entity.cloud_application = arrayFirst(belongs_to.dt.entity.cloud_application)
| filter isNotNull(dt.entity.cloud_application)
| join [
  timeseries `cpu_usage container`=avg(dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_usage), by:{dt.entity.cloud_application}
  | fieldsAdd `cpu_usage container (avg)` = arrayAvg(`cpu_usage container`)
], on:{dt.entity.cloud_application}, fields: { `cpu_usage container`, `cpu_usage container (avg)` }
| fields dt.entity.service, dt.entity.service.name, `peticiones (total)`, `tiempo de respuesta (avg)`, `cpu_usage container (avg)`

metrics.description: Response time of a service measured in microseconds on the server side (server side measurements do not include e.g. proxy and networking times). Response time is the time until a response is sent to a calling application, process or other service. It does not include further asynchronous processing. To learn how Dynatrace calculates service timings, see [Service analysis timings](https://dt-url.net/service-timings).
Number of requests received by a given service. To learn how Dynatrace detects and analyzes services, see [Services](https://dt-url.net/am-services).
This metric measures the total CPU consumed (user usage + system usage) by container. The most detailed level of aggregation is container.

input.value:
timeseries {`tiempo de respuesta`=avg(dt.service.request.response_time, default:0), peticiones=sum(dt.service.request.count )}, by:{dt.entity.service}
| fieldsAdd `tiempo de respuesta (avg)` = arrayAvg(`tiempo de respuesta`)
| fieldsAdd `peticiones (total)` = arraySum(peticiones)
| sort `peticiones (total)` desc
| fieldsAdd entityName(dt.entity.service)
| fieldsAdd belongs_to = entityAttr(dt.entity.service, "belongs_to")
| fieldsFlatten belongs_to
| fieldsAdd dt.entity.cloud_application = arrayFirst(belongs_to.dt.entity.cloud_application)
| filter isNotNull(dt.entity.cloud_application)
| join [
  timeseries `cpu_usage container`=avg(dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_usage), by:{dt.entity.cloud_application}
  | fieldsAdd `cpu_usage container (avg)` = arrayAvg(`cpu_usage container`)
], on:{dt.entity.cloud_application}, fields: { `cpu_usage container`, `cpu_usage container (avg)` }
| fields dt.entity.service, dt.entity.service.name, `peticiones (total)`, `tiempo de respuesta (avg)`, `cpu_usage container (avg)`

describe dt.entity.service
| filter in(data_types, "record")

describe dt.entity.service
| filter in(data_types, "record")

sections.markdown: ## Best Practices
# 1. Filtar al inicio.

>   El **rendimiento** general de las consultas mejora enormemente al reducir el conjunto de datos antes de continuar con el procesamiento. 

>  Segmentar la data para filtar por `dt.system.bucket`  y reducir el costo de la query.

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize by:{event.type}, count = count()

input.value:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket == "default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize by:{event.type}, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

input.value:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

sections.markdown: # 2. Reducir el rango de tiempo de consulta (si aplica)
>  De esta forma se escanea menos data y reduce el costo de la query.

# 3. Nombres de campos que se deben evitar
* true
* false
* null
* mod
* and
* or
* xor
* not

input.value: data record(`true`="ejemplo")
data record(`true`="ejemplo")

sections.markdown:
## 4. Usar m茅tricas
>  Si la data ya esta ingestada como m茅trica, usala.

>  Si utilizas comandos `summarize` o `makeTimeseries` crea m茅tricas a a partir de logs, events, etc.
## 5. Utilizar opciones para limitar la cantidad de datos escaneados (Logs | Spans锔)

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch spans
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events
| fields span.events
| fieldsFlatten span.events
| fieldsRemove span.events
| summarize by:{span.events.exception.message}, count = count()
| sort count desc

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch spans, scanLimitGBytes:1
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events
| fields span.events
| fieldsFlatten span.events
| fieldsRemove span.events
| summarize by:{span.events.exception.message}, count = count()
| sort count desc

sections.markdown:
## 6. Utilizar las opciones de muestreo disponibles (Logs | Spans锔)
Los rangos de valores aplicables para el muestreo son:

* 1: Default value (no sampling).
* 10
* 100
* 1000
* 10000:

input.value:
fetch logs, from:-7d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)
| fieldsAdd c = c*100

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch logs, from:-7d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize by:{bin(timestamp, 3h)}, c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR")
| fieldsAdd c = c * 100
grail.query:
fetch logs, from:-7d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)
| fieldsAdd c = c*100

notifications.messageFormat: The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.
notifications.message: The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.
The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.

input.value:
fetch logs, from:-7d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)
| fieldsAdd c = c*100
